name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: The primary objective of the study is to compare the efficacy of brigatinib to that of crizotinib in ALK+ locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC patients naive to ALK inhibitors, as evidenced by PFS

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: PFS, as assessed by the BIRC, per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) v1.1

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To compare the efficacy of brigatinib to that of crizotinib, as evidenced by confirmed ORR, time to/duration of response, disease control rate (DCR), and Overall Survival (OS)

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To compare the efficacy in the CNS of brigatinib to that of crizotinib, as evidenced by intracranial response and intracranial PFS in those patients with intracranial CNS metastases at baseline

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To assess patient-reported symptoms and health-related quality of life (HRQoL) with the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) Quality of Life Questionnaire (QLQ)-C30 (v3.0) and its lung cancer module, QLQ-LC13 (v3.0) in patients treated with brigatinib compared to those treated with crizotinib

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To assess the safety and tolerability of brigatinib in comparison with crizotinib

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To determine PK parameters of brigatinib through population PK modeling

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Confirmed ORR, as assessed by the BIRC, per RECIST v1.1

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Confirmed intracranial ORR, as assessed by the BIRC

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Intracranial PFS, as assessed by the BIRC

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Duration of response, as assessed by the BIRC

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Time to response, as assessed by the BIRC

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Disease control rate, as assessed by the BIRC

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Change from baseline scores in global health status/quality of life (QOL) assessed with the EORTC QLQ-C30 (v3.0), and time-to-deterioration in dyspnea assessed with the EORTC QLQ-LC13 (v3.0)

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To assess confirmed ORR on brigatinib in patients who crossover to brigatinib from Arm B (crizotinib); and to assess PFS, from the first dose of brigatinib, in patients who crossover to brigatinib from Arm B

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: To explore relationship of brigatinib exposure with both efficacy and safety

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: Confirmed ORR for brigatinib, as assessed by the BIRC, per RECIST v1.1, in patients who crossover from Arm B (crizotinib)

name: input\Prot_000
statement_text: PFS from the first dose of brigatinib, as assessed by the BIRC, per RECIST v1.1, in  patients who crossover from Arm B (crizotinib)

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text: The primary objective is to assess clinical benefit rate after 24 weeks of treatment with PDR001+LAG525 based on local investigator assessment.

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text:
Assess CBR at 24 weeks of PDR001+LAG525 by tumor type in multiple solid and lymphoma

For patients with solid tumors the assessment criteria will be RECIST 1.1 and will include responses of CR or PR or SD. For 
lymphoma, assessment criteria will be the Revised Response Criteria for Malignant Lymphoma, (Cheson et al 2007).

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text:
To assess Overall Response (OR) of Partial Response (PR) or Complete Response (CR) based on local investigator 
assessment.
outcome measure: Overall Response, Partial Response, Complete Response

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text: Time to response (TTR) is defined as the time from the date of first dose to the date of first documented response of CR or PR

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text: The duration of response (DOR) applies only to patients whose best response was PR or CR. The duration of response is defined as the time from the first documented response to the date first documented disease progression or relapse or death due to any cause. The duration of response will be summarized descriptively for each tumor cohort.

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text: Time to progression (TTP) is defined as the time from the date of first dose to the date of first documented disease progression or relapse.

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text: Progression free survival (PFS) is defined as the time from the date of first dose to the date of first documented disease progression or relapse or death due to any cause.

name: input\Prot_001
statement_text: Assess ORR by RECIST 1.1 in solid tumors

statement_text: Duration of severe neutropenia in Cycle 1 (DSN);
